content:
• Thursday, April 12, 2012
  • TLB

    Talbots (NYSE:TLB) -7.3% AH after reporting a Q4 EPS loss of $0.77 vs. a $0.04 loss in the...

    Talbots (NYSE:TLB) -7.3% AH after reporting a Q4 EPS loss of $0.77 vs. a $0.04 loss in the year-ago period and missing the consensus of a $0.51 loss. Revenues fell 1.1% Y/Y to $2894M, beating the $269M, but Q1 revenue is guided lower to ~$272M vs. $284M consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:12 PM
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS -6.4%), off sharply for the second day following the DOJ's e-book...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS -6.4%), off sharply for the second day following the DOJ's e-book settlement with 3 publishers, is up 1.6% AH after announcing a version of its Nook Simple Touch e-reader with built-in lighting. The product is said to be "optimized for low-light conditions," and will sell for $139. Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN), whose Kindle Touch goes for $99, is reportedly working on a front-lit Kindle.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:08 PM
  • SRPT

    AVI BioPharma (AVII) says in an SEC filing its chief scientific officer, Peter Linsley, Ph.D.,...

    AVI BioPharma (AVII) says in an SEC filing its chief scientific officer, Peter Linsley, Ph.D., intends to resign from his position effective June 1. Shares -7.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM
  • OUTR

    Coinstar (NASDAQ:CSTR) has resumed trading following its Q1 preannouncement. Shares are...

    Coinstar (NASDAQ:CSTR) has resumed trading following its Q1 preannouncement. Shares are currently moving at $71.19, a new all-time high and up 16.3% from today's close. Jim Chanos can't be pleased.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM | 3 Comments
  • GOOG

    Google (NASDAQ:GOOG): Q1 EPS of $10.08 beats by $0.43. Revenue of $8.14B (+24% Y/Y) misses by...

    Google (NASDAQ:GOOG): Q1 EPS of $10.08 beats by $0.43. Revenue of $8.14B (+24% Y/Y) misses by $10M. Company announces "effectively, a 2-for-1 stock split" with a new class of nonvoting shares. Shares +1.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 12 Comments
  • OUTR

    Coinstar (NASDAQ:CSTR) preannounces a blowout Q1. Citing strong demand for a number of hit...

    Coinstar (NASDAQ:CSTR) preannounces a blowout Q1. Citing strong demand for a number of hit titles, as well as lower-than-expected expenses, the company expects revenue for the quarter to be $567M-$569.2M and EPS of $1.36-$1.40, well above a consensus of $537.7M and $0.90. Coinstar is also guiding for 2012 revenue of $2.155B-$2.28B and EPS of $4.40-$4.80, compared with a consensus of $2.22B and $4.09. Shares are halted.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • JPM

    JPMorgan Chase (JPM +2.1%) kicks off quarterly earnings reports for the big banks tomorrow, and...

    JPMorgan Chase (JPM +2.1%) kicks off quarterly earnings reports for the big banks tomorrow, and S&P Capital IQ raises its rating on the shares to Buy from Hold with a $49 target price from $42 on expectations of a mostly positive report and an attractive valuation. The Street expects EPS of $1.12 on revenue of $24.37B, both lower than in the same period last year.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • ARNA

    A day after rallying, Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA -6.2%) is giving back its gains, and has...

    A day after rallying, Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA -6.2%) is giving back its gains, and has managed to trigger the SEC's Rule 201. Earlier this week, the drgumaker filed to sell 8.6M shares owned by Deerfield Management, which invested in the company in 2010.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM | 8 Comments
  • HD

    Home Depot's (HD +1.7%) revenue took a $13B hit at its worst point in 2006, and it will need a...

    Home Depot's (HD +1.7%) revenue took a $13B hit at its worst point in 2006, and it will need a stronger upturn in housing to speed the recovery of that lost revenue, CEO Frank Blake tells CNBC. "We grew in 2010, we grew in 2011, so we're kind of clawing our way back," but it could take "several years" unless there's a stronger housing recovery.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM | 3 Comments
  • BJRI

    BJ's Restaurants (BJRI +2.9%) trades higher after Barclays chimes in with a Buy rating and $57...

    BJ's Restaurants (BJRI +2.9%) trades higher after Barclays chimes in with a Buy rating and $57 price target. Analyst Jeff Bernstein justifies the company's high-flying earning multiple by comparing the restaurant chain to fast-growing peers and factoring in its unit growth potential.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM | 2 Comments
  • ILMN

    Illumina (ILMN -5.6%), which has twice rejected Roche's (OTCQX:RHHBY) takeover bids, drops below...

    Illumina (ILMN -5.6%), which has twice rejected Roche's (OTCQX:RHHBY) takeover bids, drops below the latest $51/share offer price for the first time as investors grow concerned the deal will be abandoned. The offer is “more than adequate to serve as a basis” to start talks and “is full, fair and extremely attractive by every conceivable financial metric,” Roche says today.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • AA

    It's a good day to own commodity stocks. Alcoa's (AA +2.5%) strong Q1 and China optimism is not...

    It's a good day to own commodity stocks. Alcoa's (AA +2.5%) strong Q1 and China optimism is not only lifting aluminum names, but also makers of steel (SLX +4.7%), copper (CU +4.1%), silver (SLVP +2.7%), and gold (PSAU +3.8%), among other things.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM | 2 Comments
  • RENN

    In spite of today's outages, Chinese Internet names are rallying strongly thanks to hopes for a...

    In spite of today's outages, Chinese Internet names are rallying strongly thanks to hopes for a strong GDP report.  RENN +8.6%. SINA +5.9%. BIDU +3.4%. SOHU +3.9%. YOKU +5.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM | 2 Comments
  • FSLR

    Some solar stocks (TAN +0.4%) give back yesterday's gains after Chardan analyst Jay Srivatsa...

    Some solar stocks (TAN +0.4%) give back yesterday's gains after Chardan analyst Jay Srivatsa says more bankruptcies in the sector are coming in the next two or three quarters. The sector outlook is "dismal," the firm says, as even large firms such as First Solar (FSLR -1.9%) idle production lines and others suspend commercial production.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • ALT

    Shares of PharmAthene (PIP +2.2%) head higher after sitting in negative territory most of the...

    Shares of PharmAthene (PIP +2.2%) head higher after sitting in negative territory most of the day off of word that the company will add a Phase II trial for SparVax after seeing high efficacy rates in initial human clinical trials on the anthrax vaccine.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM
  • MIPS

    Shares of MIPS Technologies (NASDAQ:MIPS) skyrocket 17.8% higher off of a report that tips off...

    Shares of MIPS Technologies (NASDAQ:MIPS) skyrocket 17.8% higher off of a report that tips off the company has hired Goldman Sachs to find a buyer and facilitate a sale of itself.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • ANRZQ

    Coal companies Alpha Natural Resources (ANR +8.9%) and Peabody Energy (BTU +7.3%) rank among the...

    Coal companies Alpha Natural Resources (ANR +8.9%) and Peabody Energy (BTU +7.3%) rank among the day's top gainers amid signs the Fed may pump up growth after all (I, II) and sentiment that the worst could be over for coal shares - they're "a great buying opportunity now," BlackRock's Dan Rice says, expecting U.S. coal output to decline 11% this year and help shore up coal prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM | 5 Comments
  • P

    Pandora (P +3%) is rallying in spite of being started at Neutral by SunTrust. The company has...

    Pandora (P +3%) is rallying in spite of being started at Neutral by SunTrust. The company has become a source of lively debate on SA: Helix Investment praises Pandora's strong mobile growth and local ad sales efforts, and Rocco Pendola follows up by discussing its forward-looking, tech-oriented management. Spencer Osborne, commenting on a digital media study, voices concerns about Pandora's high content costs and competition.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM
  • YPF

    Argentina's government appears to be making an already difficult environment worse for...

    Argentina's government appears to be making an already difficult environment worse for attracting investors to develop its Vaca Muerta shale fields, after revoking licenses from YPF (YPF +8.3%) and Petrobras (PBR +2.5%) over an investment dispute. The deposit holds over 23B boe in an area roughly the size of Connecticut. “None of the majors would want to step into a field that’s been expropriated from a fellow major," RBC's Peter Hutton says.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM | 11 Comments
  • BA

    Boeing (BA +2.4%) updates its order and delivery totals for 2012 after adjusting for recent buys...

    Boeing (BA +2.4%) updates its order and delivery totals for 2012 after adjusting for recent buys and cancellations. The manufacturer now shows 415 net orders for the year, led by a whopping order for 230 737s from Lion Air placed in February.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM | 1 Comment
  • CMG

    Chipotle (CMG +1.6%) trades higher after Argus initiates the shares with a Buy rating. The firm...

    Chipotle (CMG +1.6%) trades higher after Argus initiates the shares with a Buy rating. The firm says same-store sales and unit growth are likely to remain among the highest in the sector, and that recent price increases have been absorbed by customers.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM | 11 Comments
  • GME

    Baird's Colin Sebastian says the negative sentiment in GameStop (GME +1.8%) presents a buying...

    Baird's Colin Sebastian says the negative sentiment in GameStop (GME +1.8%) presents a buying opportunity. He cites a number of upcoming catalysts, including an improving product line, the upcoming E3 industry conference and a potential upswing in seasonal momentum.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM
  • EGO

    Shares of Eldorado Gold (EGO +9.2%) surge after the miner says it plans $1.95B of development...

    Shares of Eldorado Gold (EGO +9.2%) surge after the miner says it plans $1.95B of development spending over the next five years to reach its production target of 1.7M ounces of gold annually by 2016. The expansion will make EGO "one of the fastest growing emerging senior gold producers globally," CEO Paul Wright says.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • REGN

    Regeneron (REGN +1.8%) gains on positive comments out of BMO Capital this morning, saying that...

    Regeneron (REGN +1.8%) gains on positive comments out of BMO Capital this morning, saying that Roche's (OTCQX:RHHBY +2.5%) Lucentis market share is declining, and the number of patients switching to Eylea from other treatments is accelerating. The firm maintains an Outperform rating on the stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • INFY

    Infosys (INFY -1.4%) faces accusations from a whistleblower that the firm brought in illegal...

    Infosys (INFY -1.4%) faces accusations from a whistleblower that the firm brought in illegal workers to do tech jobs within the U.S. Consultant Jay Palmer filed suit against the company in Alabama earlier this year in a case that continues to leak details on the company's alleged policies. (Previous: Texas investigates INFY)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • MBI

    MBIA (MBI +6.5%) shares shoot higher after UBS, Aurelius Capital and Fir Tree settle lawsuits...

    MBIA (MBI +6.5%) shares shoot higher after UBS, Aurelius Capital and Fir Tree settle lawsuits against the company and MKM Partners surmises that Bank of America, Societe Generale and Natixis may reach deals with MBIA as soon as next Friday. The plaintiffs allege the 2009 split of MBIA’s bond insurance business hurt owners of $240B of debt while benefiting stock investors.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • WLL

    Whiting Petroleum (WLL +3.5%) moves up after Brean Murray initiated the shares with a Buy on...

    Whiting Petroleum (WLL +3.5%) moves up after Brean Murray initiated the shares with a Buy on valuation earlier today and added it to its Near-Term Conviction list. The firm recommends owning the shares ahead of initial Bakken drilling, saying the results should a good "line of sight" on its remaining development inventory.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • MSFT

    LinkedIn (LNKD +7.2%) jumps after SunTrust starts coverage with a Buy, and Morgan Stanley...

    LinkedIn (LNKD +7.2%) jumps after SunTrust starts coverage with a Buy, and Morgan Stanley (Overweight) lifts its PT to $115 from $105. MS says its analysis of LinkedIn's sales efficiency found the company's recent aggressive hiring had a minimal impact on productivity, and that leads the firm to hike its margin forecasts. SunTrust is also starting Google (GOOG +1.3%), Web.com (WWWW +5%) and Netflix (NFLX +3.2%) at Buy.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • LPT

    Liberty Property Trust (LRY +1.8%) is upgraded while EastGroup Properties (EGP +0.5%) is reduced...

    Liberty Property Trust (LRY +1.8%) is upgraded while EastGroup Properties (EGP +0.5%) is reduced by Cowen &Co. LRY "is executing well on its portfolio repositioning plan that includes reducing its exposure to suburban office and increasing its weighting in industrial and CBD office"; the firm is less impressed with EGP’s prospects.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • UTHR

    United Therapeutics (UTHR -2.6%) shares are downgraded to Market Perform from Outperform with a...

    United Therapeutics (UTHR -2.6%) shares are downgraded to Market Perform from Outperform with a new price target of $48 from $65 by Leerink Swann, which cites generic risk to its treatment of pulmonary arterial hypertension. A recent survey by the firm says "most physicians believe that a minority of their patients are candidates for oral Remodulin."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM
  • ARB

    Arbitron (ARB -0.3%) lags the overall market after saying its CFO Richard Surratt will step down...

    Arbitron (ARB -0.3%) lags the overall market after saying its CFO Richard Surratt will step down next month, and Sean Creamer, the media and marketing research company's COO and former CFO, will temporarily assume his duties until a successor is found.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • FIO

    Heavily-shorted Fusion-io (FIO +10.9%) soars after Piper says it believes the flash memory...

    Heavily-shorted Fusion-io (FIO +10.9%) soars after Piper says it believes the flash memory module vendor is working on an OEM deal with Cisco related to its popular UCS server line. Piper adds Cisco could become a 10% customer in the next 3-4 quarters, and that top customer Facebook could generate $201M in 2012 revenue. In addition, Fusion-io, which primarily relies on the server market, is announcing Fusion ioFX, a solution meant for workstations handling content creation apps.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM | 1 Comment
  • SWY

    Shares of Safeway (SWY +3.3%) pick up steam as chatter percolates around that the grocery store...

    Shares of Safeway (SWY +3.3%) pick up steam as chatter percolates around that the grocery store chain is on the radar of as a takeover candidate. SA author Takeover Analyst already identified Safeway as a beneficiary of industry consolidation.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM | 3 Comments
  • HPQ

    Though Nomura isn't thrilled with Gartner's Q1 PC data (I, II), it, along with similar data from...

    Though Nomura isn't thrilled with Gartner's Q1 PC data (I, II), it, along with similar data from IDC, is stoking a major rally in H-P (HPQ +6.2%). Gartner estimates H-P's share rose 30 bps Y/Y and 120 bps Q/Q, reversing the declines seen due to last year's drama. Dell (DELL-OLD +0.1%), which is believed to have lost share, and just received bearish comments from Jim Chanos, is undeperforming.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • RDS.A

    Congrats (for now) to those who bought the dip in Shell (RDS.A +0.1%), which dropped nearly 5%...

    Congrats (for now) to those who bought the dip in Shell (RDS.A +0.1%), which dropped nearly 5% premarket on reports of an oil slick near its platforms in the Gulf of Mexico.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS -4%) drops again as the e-book settlement (I, II) appears likely to...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS -4%) drops again as the e-book settlement (I, II) appears likely to prompt rival Amazon (AMZN +2.1%) to cut prices to grab market share and further pressure profit margins for BKS if it gets into an e-book pricing war.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • CROX

    Shares of Crocs (CROX +1.7%) trade higher after Longbow Research lines up the company with a Buy...

    Shares of Crocs (CROX +1.7%) trade higher after Longbow Research lines up the company with a Buy rating and $26 price target on the strength of the shoe seller's vision in Asia.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • RDC

    Rowan (RDC +7.8%) shares surge after the company’s board approves a bid to move the...

    Rowan (RDC +7.8%) shares surge after the company’s board approves a bid to move the corporate headquarters to the U.K., and confirms it’s actively pursuing a Class A share structure in place of its current U.S. listing as American depositary shares, which would allow it to remain in the S&P 500.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM | 1 Comment

  • Gold shoots out of a quiet trading range it's been in for the last 48 hours, leaping 1% in the...

    Gold shoots out of a quiet trading range it's been in for the last 48 hours, leaping 1% in the past minutes to $1,670/oz. GLD +0.7%. Silver is on the move too, leaping $0.55 to $32.05/oz. SLV +2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM | 6 Comments
  • EQIX

    High-flying Equinix (EQIX +1.8%) rallies after Wells Fargo says its checks indicate the data...

    High-flying Equinix (EQIX +1.8%) rallies after Wells Fargo says its checks indicate the data center owner is gaining traction with customers providing managed hosting and cloud services, and enterprise growth (historically a laggard) is picking up. Wells adds Equinix, a beneficiary of the ongoing boom in data center construction/demand, is seeing strong demand in key markets such as NYC, Silicon Valley, and D.C., and recently "won a couple of larger deals."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM | 3 Comments
  • FAST

    Fastenal (FAST -1.5%) slips after posting in-line Q1 results on revenue, but missing slightly on...

    Fastenal (FAST -1.5%) slips after posting in-line Q1 results on revenue, but missing slightly on a per share basis. Profit actually jumped 26% Y/Y on strong sales of industrial production supplies to manufacturers.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM
  • GDP

    Deutsche Bank issues a Buy rating for Goodrich Petroleum (GDP +6.3%), noting "GDP's solid Eagle...

    Deutsche Bank issues a Buy rating for Goodrich Petroleum (GDP +6.3%), noting "GDP's solid Eagle Ford oil growth, with implications for cash flow and security of funding, remains underappreciated by the Street." Two catalysts could boost shares: natural gas via Haynesville, and the Tuscaloosa Marine Shale developing liquids play in Mississippi and Louisiana.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • FET

    After pricing its IPO at $20, Forum Energy (NYSE:FET) debuts on the NYSE and is trading up over...

    After pricing its IPO at $20, Forum Energy (NYSE:FET) debuts on the NYSE and is trading up over 14% at $22.90. The company provides products and services for the oil and natural gas industries globally.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • MOH

    Molina Healthcare (MOH +4.4%) catches a bounce as Merrill says Texas will contract with...

    Molina Healthcare (MOH +4.4%) catches a bounce as Merrill says Texas will contract with incumbent Medicaid HMO providers for "dual eligible" individuals. Notable calls says it's good news for the big players in Texas (MOH, CNC, AGP), and suggests the news from Ohio - which caused a drubbing this week - could be an isolated data point.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM
  • AONEQ

    A lithium-ion battery manufactured by A123 Systems (AONE -1.9%) is behind the injury-causing...

    A lithium-ion battery manufactured by A123 Systems (AONE -1.9%) is behind the injury-causing explosion at a General Motors (GM +0.6%) battery lab, according to reports.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM | 4 Comments
  • KKR

    KKR will invest $65M in China Cord Blood (CO +22.2%), the country’s largest operator of...

    KKR will invest $65M in China Cord Blood (CO +22.2%), the country’s largest operator of services for umbilical cord blood that is rich in stem cells, to capitalize on China’s fast growing healthcare services industry. As share prices of U.S.-listed Chinese companies take a beating, some PE firms sniff opportunities.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM
  • BBBY

    Shares of Bed Bath & Beyond (NASDAQ:BBBY) lose 1.1% premarket after getting tripped up by a...

    Shares of Bed Bath & Beyond (NASDAQ:BBBY) lose 1.1% premarket after getting tripped up by a downgrade from Canaccord Genuity to Hold from Buy. The Street still has a bullish vibe on BBBY with only one analyst covering the stock out of 26 deeming it a Sell or Underweight despite shares sailing past a 52-week high last week.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM
  • DRYS

    DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS) increases the size of a previously announced offering of shares to 10M...

    DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS) increases the size of a previously announced offering of shares to 10M and prices it at $16.25 a pop. Companies affiliated with the CEO have agreed to purchase 1.9M of the shares. Shares +0.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM | 2 Comments
  • PCRX

    Pacira Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:PCRX) -2.2% premarket after announcing plans to offer more common...

    Pacira Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:PCRX) -2.2% premarket after announcing plans to offer more common shares to advance the commercialization of its painkiller Exparel.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM
  • RDS.A

    Shares of Royal Dutch Shell (NYSE:RDS.A) extend their loss - now down 4.4% premarket - after...

    Shares of Royal Dutch Shell (NYSE:RDS.A) extend their loss - now down 4.4% premarket - after reports of "light sheen" in the Gulf rattle investors. The company says that it has no indication at the moment that the sheen originates from production sites in the region.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM | 1 Comment
  • MCK

    Premarket gainers: MCK +5%. IRE +4%. RIO +3%. TSCO +3%.Losers: RDS.A -4%. NOK -4%.

    Premarket gainers: MCK +5%. IRE +4%. RIO +3%. TSCO +3%.
    Losers: RDS.A -4%. NOK -4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • HCA

    HCA downwardly revises Q1 revenue, expecting $8.38B-$8.43B vs. $8.87B consensus and $7.41B in...

    HCA downwardly revises Q1 revenue, expecting $8.38B-$8.43B vs. $8.87B consensus and $7.41B in the year-ago period, and EBITDA of $1.795B-$1.845B vs. $1.59B a year ago. HCA says its revenue estimate includes two upward adjustments for Medicaid for a combined total of $188M. HCA +1.9% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM
  • TSCO

    Tractor Supply (NASDAQ:TSCO) gains 2.9% in premarket trading after saying it expects to report...

    Tractor Supply (NASDAQ:TSCO) gains 2.9% in premarket trading after saying it expects to report Q1 earnings well-ahead of the consensus estimate of analysts and ups its 2012 profit guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:53 AM
  • WAB

    Wabtec (NYSE:WAB) +6.6% after announcing it expects Q1 EPS of $1.20 and 2012 EPS of $4.80, above...

    Wabtec (NYSE:WAB) +6.6% after announcing it expects Q1 EPS of $1.20 and 2012 EPS of $4.80, above Street estimates of $1.02 and $4.37. The maker of locomotive/freight subsystems partly attributes its guidance hike to strength in the global freight rail market. Wabtec's Q1 report is due on April 24. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:47 AM
  • APOG

    Industrial glass maker Apogee Enterprises (NASDAQ:APOG) -8.1% premarket after reporting a FQ4...

    Industrial glass maker Apogee Enterprises (NASDAQ:APOG) -8.1% premarket after reporting a FQ4 profit with a downbeat outlook for its new fiscal year, citing “an expected first-quarter gap in project flow,” followed by “improvement in commercial construction market conditions occurring in the second half.”

     
     
     
     
    | 8:45 AM
  • RDS.A

    Shell (NYSE:RDS.A) is down 2.4% premarket after an oil slick was reportedly spotted near its...

    Shell (NYSE:RDS.A) is down 2.4% premarket after an oil slick was reportedly spotted near its platforms in the Gulf of Mexico. Media reports say the slick is 10 square miles and that the company is sending a spill-response vessel.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 AM | 5 Comments

  • Australian payrolls rose a larger-than-expected 44K in March. The jobless rate stayed at 5.2%...

    Australian payrolls rose a larger-than-expected 44K in March. The jobless rate stayed at 5.2% compared with expectations for a rise to 5.3%. Aussie dollar +0.7% vs. USD.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 AM
